items.headline: AI Disruption Fears Drive Global Market Downturn and Sector Rotation
items.summary: Global markets experienced significant volatility on Friday, February 13, 2026, with major US indices closing sharply lower on Thursday as investor sentiment shifted amid growing concerns about the disruptive potential of artificial intelligence across various industries. Indian benchmarks also tumbled, particularly in IT and metal sectors. A noticeable rotation out of tech-heavy investments into more 'tangible' sectors like industrials, energy, and basic materials is underway. Despite the cautious sentiment, some areas of the forex market showed cautious optimism due to mixed economic data and geopolitical developments. US stock futures indicated a softer opening on Friday morning.

items.headline: US Foods Holding surges on strong earnings
items.summary: US Foods Holding ($USFD) jumped 13.40% after reporting robust Q4 earnings and providing optimistic 2026 guidance.

items.headline: Equinix gains on raised targets and dividend
items.summary: Equinix ($EQIX) rose 10.41% as multiple banks raised price targets following the company's positive earnings and dividend increase.

items.headline: Motorola Solutions up on strong outlook
items.summary: Motorola Solutions ($MSI) climbed 7.67% after issuing favorable 2026 guidance and reporting solid Q4 results.

items.headline: AppLovin tumbles on mixed reactions
items.summary: AppLovin ($APP) saw a significant drop of 19.7%, impacted by mixed analyst reactions to its recent results and several price target changes.

items.headline: C.H. Robinson Worldwide declines on automation fears
items.summary: C.H. Robinson Worldwide ($CHRW) declined 14.54% amid fears that AI-driven automation could compress margins in the logistics sector.

items.headline: Cisco Systems hit by weak guidance
items.summary: Cisco Systems ($CSCO) fell 12.3% after providing weak guidance and missing on adjusted gross margin, intensifying concerns about tech spending cycles.

items.headline: AI Disruption Fuels Significant Sector Rotation
items.summary: Investors are actively re-evaluating business models susceptible to AI disruption, leading to a notable shift in sector preferences. Industrials, Energy, and Basic Materials are currently leading, alongside Utilities and Consumer Staples. Meanwhile, technology, communication services, and financials have fallen in favor, with the S&P 500 Information Technology sector being a particularly weak performer. This widespread rotation reflects concerns over AI's impact on tech valuations and enterprise spending cycles.

items.headline: US Inflation Data Takes Center Stage
items.summary: All eyes are on the release of US Consumer Price Index (CPI) data today, a key event expected to influence financial markets and expectations for the Federal Reserve's future policy. Economists anticipate a 0.3% monthly increase and an annual core inflation rate easing to 2.5%.

items.headline: Mixed Earnings Reports Influence Individual Stocks
items.summary: Several companies reported earnings today. US Foods Holding ($USFD) and Motorola Solutions ($MSI) posted strong results, leading to significant gains. However, Coinbase Global ($COIN) saw its Q4 EPS miss estimates significantly, and Essent Group ($ESNT) also missed expectations. The Wendy's Company ($WEN) reported Q4 and full-year 2025 results in line with expectations, with international sales showing strong growth. In India, Indian Hotels Company and Biocon reported profit growth, while Hindalco Industries saw a 45% drop in Q3 net profit.

items.headline: Global Economic Developments and Geopolitical Factors
items.summary: The Russian central bank unexpectedly cut its key interest rate by 0.5% to 15.5% amidst a slowing economy. Concerns over higher interest rates continued to make gold less attractive for some investors. Meanwhile, the US and Taiwan finalized a trade deal to reduce tariffs, a move seen as fostering prosperous trade ties.
